Fire giants are a type of giant known for their high gold charm drop rate. While they have the second highest combat level among giants, they have the lowest max hit, making them easy to kill.

Fire giants are weak to Magic, specifically water spells, and any tier 70 or higher Magic weapon should suffice. Lower-levelled players may need to mitigate damage taken via additional food or vampyrism effects such as the aura, scrimshaw, or superior scrimshaw.

Herbicide or the herb bag, and the gem bag can be useful when killing fire giants due to their relatively common herb and uncut gem drops.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Smoke Dungeon85None6Maplink
Chaos Tunnels85None20Maplink
Baxtorian Falls resource dungeon85None11Maplink
Waterfall Dungeon85None11Maplink
Brimhaven Dungeon85None13Maplink

They are most easily accessed through Brimhaven dungeon, requiring 875 coins or the hard Karamja achievements to be completed. After completion of the Waterfall Quest, the Waterfall Dungeon can also be used. With completion of the quest and level 35 Dungeoneering, the Baxtorian Falls resource dungeon may also be used.

Chaos Tunnels have the advantage of being close to the Wilderness Crater lodestone and having no requirements. At the lodestone, go south and enter the north-western entrance of the tunnels, then go south through the portal to reach the fire giants. However, there is a small chance the portal would teleport you to a random room. Therefore, it is advised to have a teleport out handy and retry if needed.

While they may also be fought in the Smoke Dungeon under Pollnivneach, it requires face protection via a face mask or slayer helmet. However, placing a slayer helmet in a stand in the tier 3 Slayer Lodge passively grants the effects of a face mask.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 36,872 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Fire giant kill is worth 1,115 coins.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • update 1 August 2022 (Update):
    • Fire giants are removed from Deep Wilderness Dungeon and Wilderness.
  • ninja 1 March 2021 (Update):
    • Fire giants now attack with melee and are weak to water spells.
  • ninja 16 October 2017 (Update):
    • Fire giants now drop batwing wands or books instead of fire battlestaves on free worlds.
  • ninja 25 April 2016 (Update):
    • Improved respawn rates for Fire Giants.
  • patch 14 January 2013 (Update):
    • Updated fire giant combat levels in line with the Evolution of Combat.
  • patch 4 December 2012 (Update):
    • Fire giants dying in the Chaos Tunnels will no longer drop their loot on an unreachable tile next to the lava pit.
  • patch 24 June 2010 (Update):
    • Fire giant heads no longer shrink midway through their death animation.
  • update 8 May 2002 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Even though the TokKul-Zo is supposed to work against "TzHaar, Fire and Obsidian creatures", it has no effect on Fire Giants; as no charges are used. This may be due to the fact that the TokKul-Zo is designed for use against lava creatures.
  • A hidden update on 9 July 2013 caused fire giants to no longer be aggressive. This was reverted on 9 February 2015, making them aggressive again.
  • These monsters create a very quiet rustling or hissing sound all the time, which gets louder as you get closer to the giant. According to the Audio Options interface, this is considered an ambient sound. It likely represents their internal fire, visible from above a giant's head.
  • These monsters were popular for training ranged prior to the Evolution of Combat, but lost popularity due to their new ability to retaliate with ranged attacks of their own. They lost their ranged attacks in an update in early 2021.
  • Before the graphical updates, the Fire Giants' weapon was often thought to be a Dragon 2h sword. This was before Dragon 2hs were released in the game, so this similarity was noted by many players. One player even asked in the third Postbag from the Hedge: "Hi, I would like to ask the fire giant a question. Why is it that you have the only dragon two handed sword in the game, and you don't even drop it? Yours truly, Jabbaz". The reply was: "If you had the only dragon two-handed sword in the game, would you drop it?"[1]
  • Fire giants used to be exclusive to members until 9 October 2017 which unlocked the "Deep Wilderness" section for free players, including the dungeon the giants reside in. They became members only again when they were removed in 2022.
  • They were removed from the Deep Wilderness Dungeon on 1 August 2022 and have not been replaced; they are no longer eligible for Slayer contract (Wilderness).

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Postbag 3 - "Transcript:Barbarians, Tree Spirits, and an embarrassed Demon!", Letter 3, by Jabbaz. RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge.
